meanings.definition: A tall pole decorated with flowers and ribbons, around which people dance on May Day.
meanings.sent1: Children gathered around the maypoles, laughing and dancing.
meanings.sent2: The village square was adorned with colorful maypoles for the May Day celebration.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel climbed the maypole, thinking it was a giant tree.
meanings.sent4: The maypoles stood tall like guardians of the spring festival.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the maypoles swaying in the breeze filled the town with joy.

meanings.definition: A pole set up on May Day as a symbol of the beginning of summer festivities.
meanings.sent1: The community came together to raise the maypoles in preparation for the summer fair.
meanings.sent2: The colorful ribbons on the maypoles fluttered in the warm May breeze.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to climb the maypole, mistaking it for a scratching post.
meanings.sent4: The maypoles marked the start of the lively summer celebrations in the town.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, the shadows of the maypoles stretched across the field, signaling the beginning of summer.
